result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert F McGeshick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.
The defendant must attend and successfully complete a parenting program and comply with any treatment plans or recommendations.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting per week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions the same as count 1 with no additional community service to be performed.
Concurrent with: Count 1

records.addlTxt: Defendant Albert F McGeshick in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:20 AM. State - resolved - plead to both counts as alleged, joint recommendation for 18 months probation on each count, #1 - court costs only, #2 - $300.00 fine plus costs, additional conditions include: AODA and follow thru, attend and successfully complete a parenting program, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, employment/school. Lynch and McGeshick agree. McGeshick pleads NC to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea, and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Lynch makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. McGeshick makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months on each count - concurrent with each other, with conditions of: count #1 - costs - paid thru probation, count #2 - $300.00 fine plus costs - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, attend and successfully complete a parenting program and comply with any treatment plans or recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting per week, submit DNA sample with expunction rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on August 3, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Albert F McGeshick in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:00 AM. Lynch has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas, requests FPT. Court continues bond, accepts plea, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Albert F McGeshick in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:34 AM. McGeshick does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. McGeshick understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, has not contacted SPD but believes he is eligible. Court directs defendant to contact SPD and also given court appointed paperwork, continues bond, set for AIA. Adjourned at 10:36  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 09:15 am.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with BL
